intro: Pilosella subcymiflora subsp. hyperdoxoides, commonly known as the hyperdoxoid meadow cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and yellow flowers. The species typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually basal, with a hairy surface that gives the plant its common name. The plant is relatively small, reaching heights of up to 20 centimeters, and is often found in high-altitude environments.
